meanings.definition: Placed or positioned before something else
meanings.sent1: The preposed flowers added a pop of color to the room.
meanings.sent2: The preposed sign caught everyone's attention as they entered.
meanings.sent3: The preposed umbrella made the statue look like it was ready for rain.
meanings.sent4: Her preposed ideas stood out like a bright light in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The preposed flag fluttered proudly in the wind.

meanings.definition: To put or set in front of something else
meanings.sent1: She preposed the book on the shelf for easy access.
meanings.sent2: The artist preposed the sculpture in the center of the gallery.
meanings.sent3: He preposed the joke at the beginning of his speech to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: The chef preposed the garnish on top of the dish like a crown.
meanings.sent5: They preposed the question to spark a lively discussion.
